newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela wage hike to add 4.0 pct to inflation.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela wage hike to add 4.0 pct to inflation.

text.p: The inflationary impact of the raise in Venezuela's minimum wage announced Wednesday via a special bonus will be 4.0 percent, Labor Minister Maria Bernardoni said.
"According to Central Bank estimates, a bonus of the size of the one approved today would represent additional inflation of four percent," she told reporters at Miraflores presidential palace.
Bernardoni spoke after the announcement that the government was raising the minimum monthly salary, via a new subsidy, to 75,000 bolivars ($156), an increase of 44 percent.
The bonus for food and transportation to benefit private sector workers will be converted into salary once new social security legislation is approved by Congress.
Inflation, at a record 103 percent in 1996, has fallen dramatically and came in at 1.6 percent in March, the lowest monthly level in five years.
El Nacional newspaper reported on Wednesday that consumer prices are expected to rise 2.4 percent in April and up to 4.0 percent in May. The official 1997 target is 35 percent.
